  --text-base: 1rem; /* 16px */
  --text-lg: 1.125rem; /* 18px */
  --text-xl: 1.25rem; /* 20px */
  --text-2xl: 1.5rem; /* 24px */
  --text-3xl: 1.875rem; /* 30px */
  --text-4xl: 2.25rem; /* 36px */
  --text-5xl: 3rem; /* 48px */

  /* Spacing */
  --space-1: 0.25rem; /* 4px */
  --space-2: 0.5rem; /* 8px */
  --space-3: 0.75rem; /* 12px */
  --space-4: 1rem; /* 16px */
  --space-5: 1.25rem; /* 20px */
  --space-6: 1.5rem; /* 24px */
  --space-8: 2rem; /* 32px */
  --space-10: 2.5rem; /* 40px */
  --space-12: 3rem; /* 48px */
  --space-16: 4rem; /* 64px */
  --space-20: 5rem; /* 80px */

  /* Border Radius */
  --radius-sm: 0.25rem;
  --radius-md: 0.375rem;
  --radius-lg: 0.5rem;
  --radius-xl: 0.75rem;
  --radius-2xl: 1rem;

  /* Shadows */
  --shadow-sm: 0 1px 2px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 0.05);
  --shadow-md: 0 4px 6px -1px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.1), 0 2px 4px -2px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.1);
  --shadow-lg: 0 10px 15px -3px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.1),
    0 4px 6px -4px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.1);
  --shadow-xl: 0 20px 25px -5px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.1),
    0 8px 10px -6px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.1);

  /* Transitions */
  --transition-fast: 150ms ease-in-out;
  --transition-normal: 250ms ease-in-out;
  --transition-slow: 350ms ease-in-out;
}

/* =================================================================
   RESET & BASE STYLES
   ================================================================= */
*,
*::before,
*::after {
  box-sizing: border-box;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}

html {
  font-size: 16px;
  line-height: 1.5;
  -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
  -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
  -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
}

body {
  font-family: var(--font-primary);
  font-size: var(--text-base);
  line-height: 1.6;
  color: var(--color-text-primary);
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-bg-primary) 0%, var(--color-bg-secondary) 50%, var(--color-bg-accent) 100%);
  min-height: 100vh;
}

/* =================================================================
   TYPOGRAPHY SYSTEM
   ================================================================= */
h1,
h2,
h3,
h4,
h5,
h6 {
  font-family: var(--font-heading);
  font-weight: 700;
  line-height: 1.2;
  color: var(--color-text-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);
}

h1 {
  font-size: var(--text-4xl);
}
h2 {
  font-size: var(--text-3xl);
}
h3 {
  font-size: var(--text-2xl);
}
h4 {
  font-size: var(--text-xl);
}
h5 {
  font-size: var(--text-lg);
}
h6 {
  font-size: var(--text-base);
}

p {
  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
}

a {
  color: var(--color-secondary);
  text-decoration: none;
  transition: color var(--transition-fast);
}

a:hover {
  color: var(--color-primary);
  text-decoration: underline;
}

/* =================================================================
   LAYOUT COMPONENTS
   ================================================================= */
.container {
  width: 100%;
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 0 var(--space-4);
}

.grid {
  display: grid;
  gap: var(--space-6);
}

.grid-cols-1 {
  grid-template-columns: repeat(1, minmax(0, 1fr));
}
.grid-cols-2 {
  grid-template-columns: repeat(2, minmax(0, 1fr));
}
.grid-cols-3 {
  grid-template-columns: repeat(3, minmax(0, 1fr));
}
.grid-cols-4 {
  grid-template-columns: repeat(4, minmax(0, 1fr));
}

.flex {
  display: flex;
}

.flex-col {
  flex-direction: column;
}

.items-center {
  align-items: center;
}

.justify-center {
  justify-content: center;
}

.justify-between {
  justify-content: space-between;
}

/* =================================================================
   MODERN CARD NAVIGATION SYSTEM - NZ INSPIRED
   ================================================================= */
.site-header {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-bg-primary) 0%, var(--color-bg-secondary) 100%);
  border-bottom: 3px solid var(--color-pounamu);
  position: sticky;
  top: 0;
  z-index: 1000;
  backdrop-filter: blur(15px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg);
}

.nav-container {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: space-between;
  padding: var(--space-6) var(--space-4);
  max-width: 1400px;
  margin: 0 auto;
}

.nav-brand {
  font-family: var(--font-heading);
  font-size: var(--text-3xl);
  font-weight: 700;
  color: var(--color-primary);
  text-decoration: none;
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  gap: var(--space-2);
}

.nav-brand::before {
  content: "🧺";
  font-size: var(--text-2xl);
}

.nav-brand:hover {
  text-decoration: none;
  color: var(--color-pounamu);
  transform: translateY(-1px);
  transition: all var(--transition-fast);
}

/* Modern Card Navigation */
.main-nav {
  position: relative;
}

.main-nav ul {
  display: flex;
  list-style: none;
  gap: var(--space-2);
  align-items: center;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}

.main-nav li {
  position: relative;
}

.nav-link {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  gap: var(--space-2);
  padding: var(--space-3) var(--space-4);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  transition: all var(--transition-normal);
  color: var(--color-text-primary);
  font-weight: 600;
  text-decoration: none;
  background: var(--color-bg-warm);
  border: 2px solid transparent;
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-sm);
  position: relative;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.nav-link::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: -100%;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  background: linear-gradient(90deg, transparent, rgba(255,255,255,0.3), transparent);
  transition: left 0.5s;
}

.nav-link:hover::before {
  left: 100%;
}

.nav-link:hover {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-bg-earth) 0%, var(--color-accent) 100%);
  color: var(--color-primary);
  text-decoration: none;
  transform: translateY(-2px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg);
  border-color: var(--color-pounamu);
}

.nav-icon {
  font-size: var(--text-xl);
  transition: transform var(--transition-fast);
}

.nav-link:hover .nav-icon {
  transform: scale(1.1);
}

.nav-text-en {
  display: block;
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
}

.nav-text-mi {
  display: none;
  font-style: italic;
  color: var(--color-text-muted);
  font-size: var(--text-xs);
}

/* Dropdown Card Menus */
.dropdown-menu {
  position: absolute;
  top: 100%;
  left: 0;
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
  border: 2px solid var(--color-pounamu);
  border-radius: var(--radius-xl);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-xl);
  padding: var(--space-6);
  min-width: 280px;
  opacity: 0;
  visibility: hidden;
  transform: translateY(-10px);
  transition: all var(--transition-normal);
  z-index: 1000;
}

.nav-link:hover + .dropdown-menu,
.dropdown-menu:hover {
  opacity: 1;
  visibility: visible;
  transform: translateY(0);
}

.dropdown-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr));
  gap: var(--space-4);
}

.dropdown-card {
  background: var(--color-bg-warm);
  border: 1px solid var(--color-accent);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  padding: var(--space-4);
  transition: all var(--transition-fast);
  text-decoration: none;
  color: inherit;
  position: relative;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.dropdown-card::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  height: 3px;
  background: linear-gradient(90deg, var(--color-primary) 0%, var(--color-accent) 100%);
}

.dropdown-card:hover {
  transform: translateY(-3px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);
  border-color: var(--color-pounamu);
  text-decoration: none;
  color: inherit;
}

.dropdown-card-title {
  font-weight: 600;
  color: var(--color-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-2);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  gap: var(--space-2);
}

.dropdown-card-desc {
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  line-height: 1.4;
}

.dropdown-card-icon {
  font-size: var(--text-lg);
  color: var(--color-pounamu);
}

/* =================================================================
   CARD SYSTEM
   ================================================================= */
.card {
  background-color: var(--color-bg-primary);
  border: 1px solid var(--color-border);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  padding: var(--space-6);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-sm);
  transition: all var(--transition-normal);
}

.card:hover {
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);
  transform: translateY(-2px);
}

.card-header {
  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);
}

.card-title {
  font-size: var(--text-xl);
  font-weight: 600;
  color: var(--color-text-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-2);
}

.card-description {
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
}

/* =================================================================
   BUTTON SYSTEM
   ================================================================= */
.btn {
  display: inline-flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  gap: var(--space-2);
  padding: var(--space-3) var(--space-6);
  border-radius: var(--radius-md);
  font-weight: 500;
  text-decoration: none;
  transition: all var(--transition-fast);
  cursor: pointer;
  border: none;
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
}

.btn-primary {
  background-color: var(--color-primary);
  color: var(--color-text-inverse);
}

.btn-primary:hover {
  background-color: var(--color-gray-800);
  color: var(--color-text-inverse);
  text-decoration: none;
}

.btn-secondary {
  background-color: var(--color-bg-secondary);
  color: var(--color-text-primary);
  border: 1px solid var(--color-border);
}

.btn-secondary:hover {
  background-color: var(--color-gray-100);
  text-decoration: none;
}

/* =================================================================
   CULTURAL COMPONENTS
   ================================================================= */
.whakatauki {
  font-family: var(--font-body);
  font-style: italic;
  font-size: var(--text-lg);
  color: var(--color-primary);
  text-align: center;
  margin: var(--space-6) 0;
  padding: var(--space-4);
  background-color: var(--color-bg-accent);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  border-left: 4px solid var(--color-accent);
}

.whakatauki-translation {
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
  color: var(--color-text-muted);
  text-align: center;
  margin-top: var(--space-2);
}

/* =================================================================
   RESPONSIVE DESIGN
   ================================================================= */
@media (max-width: 1024px) {
  .main-container {
    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
    gap: var(--space-6);
  }

  .left-sidebar {
    position: static;
    order: 2;
  }

  .content-area {
    order: 1;
  }

  .hero-content {
    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
    text-align: center;
  }

  .hero-cultural-pattern {
    display: none;
  }
}

@media (max-width: 768px) {
  .nav-container {
    flex-direction: column;
    gap: var(--space-4);
  }

  .main-nav ul {
    flex-wrap: wrap;
    justify-content: center;
    gap: var(--space-3);
  }

  .main-nav a {
    padding: var(--space-2);
    font-size: var(--text-sm);
  }

  .grid-cols-2,
  .grid-cols-3,
  .grid-cols-4 {
    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
  }

  h1 {
    font-size: var(--text-3xl);
  }
  h2 {
    font-size: var(--text-2xl);
  }
  h3 {
    font-size: var(--text-xl);
  }

  .hero-title {
    font-size: var(--text-4xl);
  }

  .hero-stats {
    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
    gap: var(--space-4);
  }

  .news-grid {
    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
  }

  .featured-grid {
    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
  }

  .featured-card {
    flex-direction: column;
    text-align: center;
  }

  .section-title-main {
    font-size: var(--text-3xl);
  }

  .main-container {
    padding: var(--space-4) var(--space-3);
  }
}

@media (max-width: 480px) {
  .container {
    padding: 0 var(--space-3);
  }

  .card {
    padding: var(--space-4);
  }

  .btn {
    padding: var(--space-2) var(--space-4);
    font-size: var(--text-xs);
  }
}

/* =================================================================
   PRINT STYLES - OPTIMIZED FOR CLEAN PRINTING
   ================================================================= */
@media print {
  /* Hide all navigation, headers, footers, and sidebars */
  .no-print,
  .site-header,
  .left-sidebar,
  .site-footer,
  .external-resources-section,
  .breadcrumbs,
  nav,
  header,
  footer,
  aside {
    display: none !important;
  }

  /* Clean print layout */
  body {
    font-size: 12pt;
    line-height: 1.4;
    color: black;
    background: white;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
  }

  .main-container {
    display: block !important;
    grid-template-columns: none !important;
    max-width: none !important;
    margin: 0 !important;
    padding: 0 !important;
    gap: 0 !important;
  }

  .content-area {
    width: 100% !important;
    max-width: none !important;
    margin: 0 !important;
    padding: 0 !important;
  }

  /* Clean up cards and sections for print */
  .card,
  section,
  div[style*="background"] {
    border: 1px solid #ccc !important;
    box-shadow: none !important;
    page-break-inside: avoid;
    background: white !important;
    margin: 1rem 0 !important;
    padding: 1rem !important;
  }

  /* Ensure text is readable */
  h1,
  h2,
  h3,
  h4,
  h5,
  h6 {
    color: black !important;
    page-break-after: avoid;
  }

  p,
  li {
    color: black !important;
  }

  a {
    color: black !important;
    text-decoration: underline !important;
  }

  /* Remove gradients and fancy styling */
  * {
    background-image: none !important;
    background: white !important;
  }

  /* Page breaks */
  .page-break {
    page-break-before: always;
  }
}

/* =================================================================
   ACCESSIBILITY ENHANCEMENTS
   ================================================================= */
@media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) {
  *,
  *::before,
  *::after {
    animation-duration: 0.01ms !important;
    animation-iteration-count: 1 !important;
    transition-duration: 0.01ms !important;
  }
}

.sr-only {
  position: absolute;
  width: 1px;
  height: 1px;
  padding: 0;
  margin: -1px;
  overflow: hidden;
  clip: rect(0, 0, 0, 0);
  white-space: nowrap;
  border: 0;
}

:focus {
  outline: 2px solid var(--color-secondary);
  outline-offset: 2px;
}

/* =================================================================
   HERO SECTION STYLES
   ================================================================= */
.hero-section {
  background: linear-gradient(
    135deg,
    var(--color-bg-accent) 0%,
    var(--color-bg-secondary) 100%
  );
  padding: var(--space-16) 0;
  position: relative;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.hero-content {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 1fr auto;
  gap: var(--space-12);
  align-items: center;
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 0 var(--space-4);
}

.hero-main {
  z-index: 2;
}

.hero-title {
  font-size: var(--text-5xl);
  font-weight: 700;
  color: var(--color-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);
  line-height: 1.1;
}

.hero-tagline {
  font-size: var(--text-xl);
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-8);
  font-weight: 400;
}

.hero-description {
  font-size: var(--text-lg);
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-6);
  line-height: 1.6;
  max-width: 600px;
}

.hero-actions {
  display: flex;
  gap: var(--space-4);
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  margin-top: var(--space-6);
}

.resource-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(300px, 1fr));
  gap: var(--space-6);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-8);
}

.resource-item {
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  padding: var(--space-6);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);
  transition: transform 0.2s ease, box-shadow 0.2s ease;
  border: 1px solid var(--color-gray-200);
}

.resource-item:hover {
  transform: translateY(-2px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg);
}

.resource-item h3 {
  color: var(--color-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-2);
  font-size: var(--text-lg);
  font-weight: 600;
}

.resource-item p {
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  margin: 0;
  font-size: var(--text-base);
}

.whakatauki-container {
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
  padding: var(--space-6);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  border-left: 4px solid var(--color-accent);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-8);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);
}

.whakatauki {
  font-family: var(--font-body);
  font-style: italic;
  font-size: var(--text-lg);
  color: var(--color-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-2);
  text-align: center;
}

.whakatauki-translation {
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
  color: var(--color-text-muted);
  text-align: center;
  font-style: normal;
}

.hero-stats {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
  gap: var(--space-6);
}

.stat-item {
  text-align: center;
  padding: var(--space-4);
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
  border-radius: var(--radius-md);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-sm);
  transition: transform var(--transition-normal);
}

.stat-item:hover {
  transform: translateY(-2px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);
}

.stat-number {
  display: block;
  font-size: var(--text-3xl);
  font-weight: 700;
  color: var(--color-secondary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-1);
}

.stat-label {
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  font-weight: 500;
}

.hero-cultural-pattern {
  width: 200px;
  height: 200px;
  background: linear-gradient(
    45deg,
    var(--color-accent),
    var(--color-secondary)
  );
  border-radius: 50%;
  opacity: 0.1;
  position: absolute;
  right: -50px;
  top: 50%;
  transform: translateY(-50%);
}

/* =================================================================
   SECTION STYLES
   ================================================================= */
.section-header {
  text-align: center;
  margin-bottom: var(--space-12);
}

.section-title-main {
  font-size: var(--text-4xl);
  font-weight: 700;
  color: var(--color-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);
}

.section-subtitle {
  font-size: var(--text-lg);
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  max-width: 600px;
  margin: 0 auto;
}

.whats-new-section {
  padding: var(--space-16) 0;
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
}

.news-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr));
  gap: var(--space-6);
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 0 var(--space-4);
}

.news-card {
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
  border: 1px solid var(--color-border);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  padding: var(--space-6);
  transition: all var(--transition-normal);
  position: relative;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.news-card:hover {
  transform: translateY(-4px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg);
  border-color: var(--color-secondary);
}

.news-card.featured {
  border-color: var(--color-accent);
  background: linear-gradient(
    135deg,
    var(--color-bg-accent) 0%,
    var(--color-bg-primary) 100%
  );
}

.news-icon {
  font-size: var(--text-3xl);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);
}

.news-title {
  font-size: var(--text-xl);
  font-weight: 600;
  color: var(--color-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-3);
}

.news-description {
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  line-height: 1.6;
  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);
}

.news-badge {
  position: absolute;
  top: var(--space-4);
  right: var(--space-4);
  background: var(--color-accent);
  color: var(--color-text-inverse);
  padding: var(--space-1) var(--space-3);
  border-radius: var(--radius-sm);
  font-size: var(--text-xs);
  font-weight: 600;
  text-transform: uppercase;
  letter-spacing: 0.5px;
}

.featured-resources-section {
  padding: var(--space-16) 0;
  background: var(--color-bg-secondary);
}

.featured-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(350px, 1fr));
  gap: var(--space-6);
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 0 var(--space-4);
}

.featured-card {
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
  border: 1px solid var(--color-border);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  padding: var(--space-6);
  text-decoration: none;
  color: inherit;
  transition: all var(--transition-normal);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  gap: var(--space-4);
  position: relative;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.featured-card:hover {
  transform: translateY(-4px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg);
  text-decoration: none;
  color: inherit;
}

.featured-card.primary-card {
  border-color: var(--color-secondary);
  background: linear-gradient(
    135deg,
    var(--color-bg-accent) 0%,
    var(--color-bg-primary) 100%
  );
}

.card-icon {
  font-size: var(--text-3xl);
  flex-shrink: 0;
}

.card-content {
  flex: 1;
}

.card-title {
  font-size: var(--text-xl);
  font-weight: 600;
  color: var(--color-primary);
  margin-bottom: var(--space-2);
}

.card-description {
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  line-height: 1.5;
  margin-bottom: var(--space-3);
}

.card-meta {
  display: flex;
  gap: var(--space-2);
  flex-wrap: wrap;
}

.meta-tag {
  background: var(--color-bg-secondary);
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  padding: var(--space-1) var(--space-2);
  border-radius: var(--radius-sm);
  font-size: var(--text-xs);
  font-weight: 500;
}

.card-arrow {
  font-size: var(--text-xl);
  color: var(--color-secondary);
  transition: transform var(--transition-fast);
}

.featured-card:hover .card-arrow {
  transform: translateX(4px);
}

/* Value Proposition Section */
.value-section {
  padding: var(--space-16) 0;
  background: var(--color-bg-secondary);
}

.value-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr));
  gap: var(--space-6);
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 0 var(--space-4);
}

.value-card {
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
  border: 1px solid var(--color-border);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  padding: var(--space-8);
  text-align: center;
  transition: all var(--transition-normal);
}

.value-card:hover {
  transform: translateY(-4px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg);
  border-color: var(--color-secondary);
}

.value-icon {
  font-size: 3rem;
  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);
}

.value-card h3 {
  color: var(--color-primary);
  font-size: var(--text-xl);
  font-weight: 600;
  margin-bottom: var(--space-3);
}

.value-card p {
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  line-height: 1.6;
}

/* Teacher Resources Section */
.teacher-section {
  padding: var(--space-16) 0;
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
}

.teacher-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr));
  gap: var(--space-6);
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 0 var(--space-4);
}

.teacher-item {
  background: var(--color-bg-secondary);
  border: 1px solid var(--color-border);
  border-radius: var(--radius-md);
  padding: var(--space-6);
  text-align: center;
  transition: all var(--transition-normal);
}

.teacher-item:hover {
  transform: translateY(-2px);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);
}

.teacher-icon {
  font-size: 2.5rem;
  margin-bottom: var(--space-3);
}

.teacher-item h3 {
  color: var(--color-primary);
  font-size: var(--text-lg);
  font-weight: 600;
  margin-bottom: var(--space-2);
}

.teacher-item p {
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  line-height: 1.5;
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
}

/* =================================================================
   LAYOUT COMPONENTS - CONSISTENT SIDEBAR SYSTEM
   ================================================================= */
.main-container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 320px 1fr;
  gap: var(--space-8);
  max-width: 1400px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: var(--space-6) var(--space-4);
  min-height: calc(100vh - 80px);
  background: var(--color-bg-secondary);
}

.content-area {
  min-width: 0; /* Prevents grid overflow */
  background: var(--color-bg-primary);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  padding: var(--space-8);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-sm);
}

.left-sidebar {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-bg-warm) 0%, var(--color-bg-earth) 100%);
  border: 2px solid var(--color-pounamu);
  border-radius: var(--radius-xl);
  padding: var(--space-6);
  height: fit-content;
  position: sticky;
  top: 100px;
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-md);
  position: relative;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.left-sidebar::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  height: 4px;
  background: linear-gradient(90deg, var(--color-primary) 0%, var(--color-accent) 50%, var(--color-nz-red) 100%);
}

/* Ensure consistent sidebar on all pages */
.left-sidebar {
  display: block !important;
}

.sidebar-widget {
  margin-bottom: var(--space-6);
}

.sidebar-widget:last-child {
  margin-bottom: 0;
}

.sidebar-widget-title {

  align-items: center;
  gap: var(--space-2);
}

.sidebar-widget ul {

  padding: 0;
  margin: 0;
}

.sidebar-widget li {
  margin-bottom: var(--space-2);
}

.sidebar-widget a {
  display: block;
  padding: var(--space-2) var(--space-3);
  color: var(--color-text-secondary);
  text-decoration: none;
  border-radius: var(--radius-md);
  transition: all var(--transition-fast);
  font-size: var(--text-sm);
}

.sidebar-widget a:hover {
  background: var(--color-bg-secondary);
  color: var(--color-primary);
  text-decoration: none;
}

.cultural-accent {
  background: linear-gradient(
    135deg,
    var(--color-bg-accent) 0%,
    var(--color-bg-secondary) 100%
  );

}

/* =================================================================

   ================================================================= */
.nz-pattern {
  background-image: 
    radial-gradient(circle at 25% 25%, var(--color-accent) 2px, transparent 2px),
    radial-gradient(circle at 75% 75%, var(--color-pounamu) 2px, transparent 2px);
  background-size: 40px 40px;
  opacity: 0.1;
}

.fern-accent {
  position: relative;
}

.fern-accent::before {
  content: "🌿";
  position: absolute;
  left: -2rem;
  top: 50%;
  transform: translateY(-50%);
  font-size: 1.5rem;
  opacity: 0.3;
}

.koru-border {
  border-left: 4px solid var(--color-accent);
  position: relative;
}

.koru-border::after {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  bottom: -4px;
  left: -4px;
  width: 8px;
  height: 8px;
  background: var(--color-accent);
  border-radius: 50%;
}

/* =================================================================

}

  text-align: left;

  text-align: right;
}

  margin-bottom: var(--space-4);

}

}

.w-full {

}

}

.shadow-sm {

}
.shadow-md {

}

  box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg);

/* Treasure Grid */
.treasure-grid {

.treasure-card {

}

/* Mobile Responsiveness */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  .filter-buttons {
    gap: var(--space-1);
  }

  .filter-btn {
    padding: var(--space-1) var(--space-3);
    font-size: var(--text-sm);
  }

    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
    gap: var(--space-4);
  }

    padding: var(--space-4);
  }
}

@media (max-width: 480px) {

    margin-bottom: var(--space-6);
  }

  .treasure-icon {
    font-size: 2rem;
  }

  .treasure-title {
    font-size: var(--text-lg);
  }
}

                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">1. Society Stations: The Four Pillars (30 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Setup:</strong> Students rotate in small groups through four stations. At each station, they read the description and answer the prompt questions on a shared document or large sheet of paper.</p>
                    <a href="/resources/lesson-1-1-society-stations.html" class="print-button no-print" style="display: inline-block; margin-bottom: 1rem;">Download Printable Station Cards</a>
                    
                    <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(280px, 1fr)); gap: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); border-top: 4px solid var(--color-accent-1);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">Pillar 1: People & Community</h4>
                            <p>Who makes up the society? How are they connected? (e.g., whānau, citizenship, shared interests).</p>
                            <p><strong>Prompt:</strong> How is our school a community? What connects us?</p>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); border-top: 4px solid var(--color-accent-2);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">Pillar 2: Governance & Rules</h4>
                            <p>How are decisions made? Who holds power? What are the rules? (e.g., government, tikanga, school rules).</p>
                            <p><strong>Prompt:</strong> Who makes decisions in your family? How is that different from school?</p>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); border-top: 4px solid var(--color-accent-3);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-3);">Pillar 3: Resources & Economics</h4>
                            <p>How does the society manage its resources? (e.g., money, trade, food, land, knowledge).</p>
                            <p><strong>Prompt:</strong> What are the most important resources for our school to function?</p>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); border-top: 4px solid var(--color-accent-4);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-4);">Pillar 4: Culture & Values</h4>
                            <p>What are the shared beliefs, traditions, and stories that give the society its identity? (e.g., language, religion, art, history).</p>
                            <p><strong>Prompt:</strong> What is one value that is important to our school culture?</p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                <div id="activity-2" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">2. Systems in Action: Comparing Two Models (25 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Activity:</strong> As a class, or in pairs, students complete a Venn diagram comparing a traditional Iwi/Hapū system with a modern city system, using the four pillars as a guide.</p>
                    
                    <div class="flex">
                        <div style="width: 150px; height: 150px; border-radius: 50%; background-color: rgba(var(--rgb-accent-1), 0.2); display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Iwi/Hapū System</div>
                        <div style="width: 50px; height: 150px; text-align: center; font-size: 3rem; color: var(--color-text-secondary);">-</div>
                        <div style="width: 150px; height: 150px; border-radius: 50%; background-color: rgba(var(--rgb-accent-2), 0.2); display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Modern City System</div>
                    </div>
                     <p class="text-center">Focus on how each system handles the four pillars. What's the same? What's different?</p>
                </div>

            </section>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">
                <h2 style="color: var(--color-primary); border-bottom: 2px solid var(--color-secondary); padding-bottom: 0.5rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Aromatawai - Assessment & Next Steps</h2>
                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Formative Assessment</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>Observe group discussions at the stations.</li>

                            <li>Check the Venn diagrams for thoughtful comparisons.</li>

                <h2 style="color: white; margin-bottom: 1rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Whakaaro - Reflection</h2>
                <p style="line-height: 1.7;">Every group of people is a system.                 <div id="activity-1" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">1. What is a System? (15 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Teacher-led discussion:</strong> Introduce the three key parts of any system:</p>
                    <ul style="line-height: 1.8; margin-left: 2rem; margin-top: 1rem;">
                        <li><strong>Parts:</strong> The individual components or elements.</li>
                        <li><strong>Connections:</strong> The relationships between the parts.</li>
                        <li><strong>Purpose:</strong> What the system does or achieves.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <p style="margin-top: 1rem;"><strong>Example: A Bicycle.</strong> Parts (wheels, frame, pedals), Connections (chain connects pedals to wheel), Purpose (transportation).</p>
                    <p><strong>Activity:</strong> "Systems Spotting Game." In 1 minute, how many systems can students spot in the classroom? (e.g., the lighting system, the desk system, the human body system).</p>
                </div>

                <div id="activity-2" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">2. Draw Your System (30 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Creative Task:</strong> Students choose one system they are a part of and draw it. They must label the parts, the connections, and the overall purpose.</p>
                    <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(200px, 1fr)); gap: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">System Ideas:</h4>
                            <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                                <li>My family system</li>
                                <li>My sports team system</li>
                                <li>The school bus system</li>
                                <li>A video game system (e.g., Fortnite)</li>
                                <li>A local park ecosystem</li>
                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">Differentiation:</h4>
                            <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                                <li><strong>Support:</strong> Provide a template with boxes for "Parts," "Connections," and "Purpose." <a href="/resources/lesson-1-2-draw-your-system-template.html" class="print-button-inline">Download Template</a></li>
                                <li><strong>Extension:</strong> Ask students to add a "What if?" scenario to their drawing (e.g., "What if one part was removed?").</li>
                            </ul>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                 <div id="activity-3" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">3. Gallery Walk & Sharing (20 mins)</h3>
                    <p>Students place their drawings around the room. In small groups, they do a "gallery walk" to see each other's work. Each student shares their drawing with their small group, explaining the parts, connections, and purpose.</p>
                </div>

            </section>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">

                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Formative Assessment</h3>

                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Homework & Extension</h3>

                    </div>

            </section>

                <div id="activity-1" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">1. What is a System? (15 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Teacher-led discussion:</strong> Introduce the three key parts of any system:</p>
                    <ul style="line-height: 1.8; margin-left: 2rem; margin-top: 1rem;">
                        <li><strong>Parts:</strong> The individual components or elements.</li>
                        <li><strong>Connections:</strong> The relationships between the parts.</li>
                        <li><strong>Purpose:</strong> What the system does or achieves.</li>
                    </ul>
                    <p style="margin-top: 1rem;"><strong>Example: A Bicycle.</strong> Parts (wheels, frame, pedals), Connections (chain connects pedals to wheel), Purpose (transportation).</p>
                    <p><strong>Activity:</strong> "Systems Spotting Game." In 1 minute, how many systems can students spot in the classroom? (e.g., the lighting system, the desk system, the human body system).</p>
                </div>

                <div id="activity-2" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">2. Draw Your System (30 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Creative Task:</strong> Students choose one system they are a part of and draw it. They must label the parts, the connections, and the overall purpose.</p>
                    <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(200px, 1fr)); gap: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">System Ideas:</h4>
                            <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                                <li>My family system</li>
                                <li>My sports team system</li>
                                <li>The school bus system</li>
                                <li>A video game system (e.g., Fortnite)</li>
                                <li>A local park ecosystem</li>
                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">Differentiation:</h4>
                            <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                                <li><strong>Support:</strong> Provide a template with boxes for "Parts," "Connections," and "Purpose." <a href="/resources/lesson-1-2-draw-your-system-template.html" class="print-button-inline">Download Template</a></li>
                                <li><strong>Extension:</strong> Ask students to add a "What if?" scenario to their drawing (e.g., "What if one part was removed?").</li>
                            </ul>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                 <div id="activity-3" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">3. Gallery Walk & Sharing (20 mins)</h3>
                    <p>Students place their drawings around the room. In small groups, they do a "gallery walk" to see each other's work. Each student shares their drawing with their small group, explaining the parts, connections, and purpose.</p>
                </div>

            </section>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">

                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Formative Assessment</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">

                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Homework & Extension</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">

                    </div>
                </div>
            </section>

                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary);">Students Will Demonstrate</h3>

                <div id="activity-1" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">1. The Power Spectrum (20 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Activity:</strong> Draw a long line on the board. Label one end "Power to the People (Democracy)" and the other "Power to the Leader (Dictatorship)."</p>
                    <p><strong>Teacher-led Discussion:</strong> Introduce key concepts and have students place them on the spectrum:</p>
                    <ul style="line-height: 1.8; margin-left: 2rem; margin-top: 1rem;">
                        <li>Free & Fair Elections</li>
                        <li>One-Party Rule</li>
                        <li>Freedom of Speech</li>
                        <li>Censorship</li>
                        <li>Human Rights Protections</li>
                        <li>Rule by a Monarch (King/Queen)</li>
                        <li>Military Coup</li>
                    </ul>

                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">2. Interactive Power Analysis - "Who Has the REAL Power?" (35 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Interactive Digital Activity:</strong> Students use the interactive "Who Has the Real Power?" tool to explore how power is distributed in New Zealand's government system, discovering the difference between formal authority and actual political influence.</p>
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); margin-top: 1.5rem; border-left: 4px solid #3b82f6;">
                        <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">🎮 Launch Interactive Tool</h4>
                        <a href="/resources/who-has-the-real-power-interactive.html" target="_blank" style="display: inline-block; background: linear-gradient(135deg, #3b82f6 0%, #1d4ed8 100%); color: white; padding: var(--space-4) 2rem; text-decoration: none; border-radius: var(--radius-md); font-weight: 600; margin: var(--space-4) 0; transition: transform 0.2s ease;" onmouseover="this.style.transform='scale(1.05)'" onmouseout="this.style.transform='scale(1)'">
                            🏛️ Open "Who Has the Real Power?" Tool
                        </a>
                        <p style="font-size: var(--text-sm); color: var(--color-text-secondary); margin-top: 0.5rem;">Students work individually or in pairs to match government roles with their powers, then discuss their discoveries.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">Learning Objectives:</h4>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                            <li>Understand the difference between <strong>symbolic power</strong> and <strong>real political power</strong></li>
                            <li>Discover how the Governor-General's formal powers are exercised by the Prime Minister</li>
                            <li>Recognize voters as the ultimate source of democratic power</li>
                            <li>Analyze how different roles contribute to New Zealand's democratic system</li>
                        </ul>
                         <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2); margin-top: 1rem;">Follow-up Discussion Questions:</h4>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                            <li>What surprised you most about where real power lies in New Zealand?</li>
                            <li>Why might the Governor-General have formal powers but not use them?</li>
                            <li>How does this compare to other countries' power structures?</li>
                            <li>What does this teach us about the difference between democracy and dictatorship?</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

                 <div id="activity-3" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">3. Case Study Analysis (20 mins)</h3>

                </div>

                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">4. Group Presentations & Class Discussion (20 mins)</h3>

                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">

                <p style="line-height: 1.7;">The way a society organizes power has a massive impact on people's lives. While democracy is often messy and slow, it is built on the idea that every person has value and a voice. Authoritarian systems promise efficiency and order, but often at the cost of freedom and human rights. As we move forward, we will explore how New Zealand's unique system of government tries to balance these competing values.</p>

                <h1 style="color: var(--color-primary); margin: var(--space-4) 0;" class="wiley-hero-title">Lesson 2.2: How New Zealand's Government Works</h1>

                <p style="color: var(--color-text-secondary); font-size: var(--text-lg);">Students demystify New Zealand's system of government, learning about the roles of the King, the Governor-General, the Parliament, and the Judiciary, and exploring where power truly lies.</p>

                <h2 style="color: white; margin-bottom: 1rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Whakatūwhera - Cultural Opening</h2>
                <p style="line-height: 1.7; margin-bottom: 1rem;">In Western systems, power can be inherited through bloodlines, like a King or Queen. In Te Ao Māori, `mana` is not inherited in the same way—it is earned and demonstrated through one's actions, leadership, and service to the community. A chief's mana comes from their ability to care for their people. As we explore NZ's system, which mixes both democratic and monarchical ideas, we ask: Who has the power, and have they earned it?</p>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">
                <h2 style="color: var(--color-primary); border-bottom: 2px solid var(--color-secondary); padding-bottom: 0.5rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Ngā Whāinga Ako - Learning Intentions</h2>
                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1rem;">
                    <div>
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary);">Students Will Learn</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>The three main parts of NZ's government.</li>
                            <li>The difference between the **Head of State** and the **Head of Government**.</li>
                            <li>The role of a **constitution** in limiting power.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div>
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary);">Students Will Demonstrate</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>By correctly identifying who holds which powers.</li>
                            <li>By creating a visual map of our government system.</li>
                            <li>By explaining why the King has no real power in NZ.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">
                <h2 style="color: var(--color-primary); border-bottom: 2px solid var(--color-secondary); padding-bottom: 0.5rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Ngā Mahi - Lesson Activities (75 minutes)</h2>
                
                <div id="activity-1" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">1. The Three Branches of Government (20 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Teacher-led explanation:</strong> Introduce the three "branches" of government in New Zealand, explaining the concept of "separation of powers."</p>
                    <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr)); gap: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); border-top: 4px solid var(--color-accent-1);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">1. Parliament (Legislature)</h4>
                            <p><strong>Who:</strong> All the MPs we elect. <br><strong>Job:</strong> To make and change laws.</p>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); border-top: 4px solid var(--color-accent-2);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">2. The Government (Executive)</h4>
                            <p><strong>Who:</strong> The Prime Minister and Cabinet. <br><strong>Job:</strong> To run the country day-to-day and propose new laws.</p>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); border-top: 4px solid var(--color-accent-3);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-3);">3. The Courts (Judiciary)</h4>
                            <p><strong>Who:</strong> Judges. <br><strong>Job:</strong> To interpret and apply the law in specific cases.</p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                <div id="activity-2" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">2. Who Has the REAL Power? (30 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Activity:</strong> In groups, students are given a set of cards with different roles (e.g., The King, The Governor-General, The Prime Minister, a Judge, an MP, a voter). They also get a set of "power cards" (e.g., "Signs bills into law," "Commands the army," "Chooses the Prime Minister," "Votes for MPs," "Decides guilt or innocence").</p>
                    <p><strong>Task:</strong> Students must match the power to the correct role. This will lead them to discover that the King's and Governor-General's powers are almost entirely symbolic.</p>
                    <a href="/resources/lesson-2-2-power-cards.html" class="print-button no-print" style="display: inline-block; margin-top: 1rem;">Download Printable Power Cards</a>
                     <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">Differentiation:</h4>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                            <li><strong>Support:</strong> Provide a chart with the roles listed, and students just have to place the power cards in the correct column.</li>
                            <li><strong>Extension:</strong> Include more complex roles like "The Speaker of the House" or "The Leader of the Opposition."</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

                 <div id="activity-3" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">3. Mapping the System (25 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Creative Task:</strong> As a class or in groups, create a large visual diagram of NZ's government system. Students must draw arrows to show the connections and relationships between the different parts (e.g., Voters elect Parliament, Parliament forms the Government, the Governor-General acts on the Prime Minister's advice).</p>
                </div>

            </section>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">
                <h2 style="color: var(--color-primary); border-bottom: 2px solid var(--color-secondary); padding-bottom: 0.5rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Aromatawai - Assessment & Next Steps</h2>
                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Formative Assessment</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>Can students explain the difference between the three branches of government?</li>
                            <li>Did they correctly match the powers to the roles in the card sort?</li>
                            <li>Does their system map show the correct relationships?</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Homework & Extension</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>Research the current Governor-General of New Zealand. What is their background?</li>
                            <li>Hold a debate: "Should New Zealand become a republic?"</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section style="background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-accent) 0%, var(--color-primary) 100%); color: white; padding: var(--space-8); border-radius: var(--radius-lg);">
                <h2 style="color: white; margin-bottom: 1rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Whakaaro - Reflection</h2>
                <p style="line-height: 1.7;">New Zealand's system is a strange mix of history and modern democracy. We have a King who is our Head of State, but he has no real power. The power lies with the people we elect to Parliament. This system, while complicated, is built on an important idea: that the power of leaders should be limited by a constitution and by the will of the people. It reminds us that true strength in a system comes not from a crown, but from the collective.</p>
            </section>

                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1rem;">

                        </ul>

                    <div>
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary);">Students Will Demonstrate</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">

                <div id="activity-1" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">1. What Does a Council Actually Do? (20 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Teacher-led discussion:</strong> Brainstorm services students have used in the last week (e.g., drank tap water, put out rubbish, went to a park or library). Explain that local councils are responsible for these.</p>
                    <p><strong>Activity: Council Services Card Sort.</strong> In groups, students get a set of cards with different services (e.g., "Fixing potholes," "Building hospitals," "Running the library," "Setting foreign policy"). They must sort them into two columns: "Local Council Responsibility" and "Central Government Responsibility."</p>
                    <a href="/resources/lesson-3-1-council-services-cards.html" class="print-button no-print" style="display: inline-block; margin-top: 1rem;">Download Printable Services Cards</a>
                </div>

                <div id="activity-2" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">2. Community Issues Investigation (35 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Group Task:</strong> Each group chooses a local issue relevant to young people.</p>

                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">Example Issues:</h4>
                            <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                                <li>Not enough safe cycle lanes</li>
                                <li>The local skate park is old and broken</li>
                                <li>Not enough activities for teenagers</li>
                                <li>Too much litter in the local park</li>
                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">Investigation Steps:</h4>
                            <ol style="line-height: 1.6; margin-left: 1.5rem;">
                                <li><strong>Define the problem:</strong> What is the issue and who does it affect?</li>
                                <li><strong>Propose a solution:</strong> What is one clear action the council could take?</li>
                                <li><strong>Justify it:</strong> Why is this a good use of council resources?</li>
                            </ol>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                 <div id="activity-3" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">3. Present to the "Council" (20 mins)</h3>
                    <p>Each group has 2 minutes to present their issue and proposed solution to the class, who act as the "councillors." After all presentations, the class votes on which issue they would fund if they had a limited budget.</p>
                     <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">Differentiation:</h4>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                            <li><strong>Support:</strong> Provide a presentation template with sentence starters.</li>
                            <li><strong>Extension:</strong> Ask students to research the actual process for making a submission to their local council.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

            </section>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">

                <p style="color: var(--color-text-secondary); font-size: var(--text-lg);">Students move from learning about systems to learning how to influence them, exploring different methods of civic action and advocacy that empower them to make a positive change in their community.</p>
            </div>

            <section style="background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-secondary) 0%, var(--color-primary) 100%); color: white; padding: var(--space-8); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); margin-bottom: 2rem;">
                <h2 style="color: white; margin-bottom: 1rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Whakatūwhera - Cultural Opening</h2>
                <p style="line-height: 1.7; margin-bottom: 1rem;">The marae is a place of `whakatōhea`—where everyone has the right and responsibility to stand up and speak, to be heard, and to contribute to the collective discussion. This principle is the heart of a healthy community. Your voice has mana. It has the power to shape decisions and create change. Today, we learn how to use that voice effectively, not just on the marae, but in the council chambers, in our schools, and in our neighbourhoods.</p>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">

                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1rem;">
                    <div>
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary);">Students Will Learn</h3>

                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div>
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary);">Students Will Demonstrate</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">

                <h2 style="color: var(--color-primary); border-bottom: 2px solid var(--color-secondary); padding-bottom: 0.5rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Ngā Mahi - Lesson Activities (75 minutes)</h2>
                
                <div id="activity-1" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">1. Case Study: "The Skate Park Campaign" (20 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Shared Reading:</strong> As a class, read the <a href="/resources/skate-park-campaign.html">"The Skate Park Campaign"</a> case study about a group of young people who successfully campaigned for a new skate park.</p>
                    <p><strong>Think-Pair-Share:</strong></p>
                    <ol style="line-height: 1.8; margin-left: 2rem; margin-top: 1rem;">
                        <li><strong>Think:</strong> What was the first and most important step the students took?</li>
                        <li><strong>Pair:</strong> Discuss with a partner: Why was their campaign successful?</li>
                        <li><strong>Share:</strong> As a class, map the key steps they took from identifying the problem to achieving their goal.</li>
                    </ol>
                </div>

                <div id="activity-2" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">2. The Community Action Toolkit (30 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Teacher-led discussion:</strong> Introduce a "toolkit" of different ways to make your voice heard. Discuss the pros and cons of each method.</p>
                    <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr)); gap: 1.5rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">Tool 1: Petitions</h4>
                            <p>A formal request signed by many people. Shows widespread support.</p>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">Tool 2: Submissions</h4>
                            <p>A formal written document presented to a council or committee. Requires research and clear arguments.</p>
                        </div>
                        <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-3);">Tool 3: Protests & Marches</h4>
                            <p>A public demonstration to raise awareness. Visually powerful but can be ignored.</p>
                        </div>
                         <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                            <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-4);">Tool 4: Social Media</h4>

                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">3. Plan Your Campaign (25 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Group Task:</strong> In groups, students choose a small, realistic issue within the school (e.g., "We want a better recycling system," "We want more seating areas outside"). They create a simple campaign plan.</p>
                     <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-1);">Campaign Plan Template:</h4>
                        <a href="/resources/lesson-3-2-campaign-plan-template.html" class="print-button-inline">Download Campaign Plan Template</a>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                           <li><strong>Our Goal:</strong> What is the one specific thing we want to change?</li>
                           <li><strong>Our Target:</strong> Who has the power to make this change? (e.g., the Principal, the Board of Trustees)</li>
                           <li><strong>Our Tools:</strong> Which tools from the toolkit will we use and why? (Choose two).</li>
                           <li><strong>Our First Step:</strong> What is the very first thing we will do?</li>
                        </ul>
                         <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2); margin-top: 1rem;">Differentiation:</h4>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                            <li><strong>Support:</strong> Provide a list of pre-approved school issues to choose from.</li>
                            <li><strong>Extension:</strong> Ask students to write the first paragraph of their submission or design the first post for their social media campaign.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>

        <main class="content-area">
            <div style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">
                <a href="/y8-systems-unit.html" style="color: var(--color-secondary); text-decoration: none;">&larr; Back to Y8 Systems Unit</a>
                <h1 style="color: var(--color-primary); margin: var(--space-4) 0;" class="wiley-hero-title">Lesson 4.1: The Treaty of Waitangi & Co-Governance</h1>
                <h2 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin: 0.5rem 0; font-weight: normal;" class="wiley-section-title">The Foundation of Our Nation's Systems</h2>
                <p style="color: var(--color-text-secondary); font-size: var(--text-lg);">Students explore Te Tiriti o Waitangi not as a relic of the past, but as a living `kawenata` (covenant) that establishes the relationship between Māori and the Crown and provides a blueprint for co-governance.</p>
            </div>

            <section style="background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-secondary) 0%, var(--color-primary) 100%); color: white; padding: var(--space-8); border-radius: var(--radius-lg); margin-bottom: 2rem;">
                <h2 style="color: white; margin-bottom: 1rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Whakatūwhera - Cultural Opening</h2>
                <p style="line-height: 1.7; margin-bottom: 1rem;">Te Tiriti o Waitangi is more than a document; it is a `kawenata`, a sacred covenant. It was a promise of a relationship, a partnership between two peoples to share this land and build a future together. It was intended to create a system of co-governance. Today, we will explore that promise. We will look at what was agreed to, how that promise was broken, and how people today are working to honour it by building new systems based on partnership.</p>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">

                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1rem;">
                    <div>
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary);">Students Will Learn</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>To define **colonisation** as a system of power.</li>
                            <li>How the promises of Te Tiriti were **broken**.</li>
                            <li>The long-term **impacts** of colonisation on Māori.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div>
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary);">Students Will Demonstrate</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>By matching Treaty promises to specific colonial actions.</li>
                            <li>By analyzing examples of Māori resistance.</li>
                            <li>By explaining the intergenerational impacts of colonisation.</li>
                        </ul>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">
                <h2 style="color: var(--color-primary); border-bottom: 2px solid var(--color-secondary); padding-bottom: 0.5rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Ngā Mahi - Lesson Activities (75 minutes)</h2>
                
                <div id="activity-1" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">1. Promises vs. Reality (25 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Activity:</strong> In groups, students get a set of cards. Half the cards state a promise made in Te Tiriti (e.g., "Promise of Tino Rangatiratanga"). The other half state a specific colonial action (e.g., "The New Zealand Land Wars," "Tohunga Suppression Act 1907").</p>
                    <p><strong>Task:</strong> Students must match the colonial action to the Treaty promise it broke. This creates a powerful visual representation of the systematic violation of the covenant.</p>
                </div>

                <div id="activity-2" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">2. Defending Tino Rangatiratanga (30 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Jigsaw Activity:</strong> Divide the class into "expert" groups. Each group studies one example of Māori resistance from the <a href="/resources/maori-political-action.html">Māori Resistance Case Studies</a> handout (e.g., Parihaka, the 1975 Land March, Bastion Point).</p>
                    <p>Students then re-form into new groups with one "expert" from each area. Each expert teaches their new group about their case study. The focus is on understanding these events as legitimate political actions to defend Māori sovereignty.</p>
                </div>

                 <div id="activity-3" style="background-color: var(--color-surface); border: 1px solid var(--color-border); border-radius: var(--radius-md); padding: var(--space-6); margin: var(--space-6) 0;">
                    <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">3. The Ripple Effect (20 mins)</h3>
                    <p><strong>Class Discussion:</strong> As a class, create a "ripple effect" mind map on the board. Start with a central colonial action (e.g., "Land Confiscation"). Brainstorm the immediate impacts (loss of home, food sources), the medium-term impacts (poverty, forced urbanisation), and the long-term, intergenerational impacts (loss of language, culture, and wealth; poor health and education outcomes).</p>
                     <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md); margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                        <h4 style="color: var(--color-accent-2);">Differentiation:</h4>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.6;">
                            <li><strong>Support:</strong> Provide a list of potential impacts for students to sort into short, medium, or long-term categories.</li>
                            <li><strong>Extension:</strong> Ask students to find a modern statistic that can be traced back to these historical impacts.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>

            </section>

            <section style="margin-bottom: 2rem;">

                <div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 2rem; margin-top: 1.5rem;">
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Formative Assessment</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>Can students connect specific colonial actions to the promises of Te Tiriti?</li>
                            <li>Do they understand Māori resistance as a defence of sovereignty?</li>
                            <li>Can they explain how historical events have long-lasting consequences?</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div style="background-color: var(--color-background); padding: var(--space-6); border-radius: var(--radius-md);">
                        <h3 style="color: var(--color-secondary); margin-bottom: 1rem;">Homework & Extension</h3>
                        <ul style="line-height: 1.8;">
                            <li>Research one of the resistance movements in more detail.</li>
                            <li>Learn about the Waitangi Tribunal and its role in addressing historical grievances.</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </section>

            <section style="background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-accent) 0%, var(--color-primary) 100%); color: white; padding: var(--space-8); border-radius: var(--radius-lg);">
                <h2 style="color: white; margin-bottom: 1rem;" class="wiley-section-title">Whakaaro - Reflection</h2>
                <p style="line-height: 1.7;">Confronting the history of colonisation can be difficult and uncomfortable, but it is essential work. It allows us to understand the root causes of many of the inequalities we see in Aotearoa today. This knowledge does not ask us to feel guilty for the past, but to take responsibility for the present. Decolonisation is the work of all of us—it is the process of healing, of restoring justice, and of finally honouring the covenant that was made in 1840.</p>
            </section>
